sentences.en: A new format would alienate its ageing readership without attracting young readers.
sentences.cn: 新的版式会疏远上了年纪的读者群，并且也不会吸引年轻读者。

sentences.en: As long as we keep on doing so, we shall not alienate ourselves from the masses.
sentences.cn: 只要我们这样干了, 就不会脱离群众.

sentences.en: Avoid being overly opinionated or you will alienate friends.
sentences.cn: 不要太固执,免得疏远朋友.

sentences.en: Disagreements alienate teenagers from their families.
sentences.cn: 意见不合使青少年们与他们的家庭疏远.

sentences.en: Dodo says pranks can also potentially alienate or hurt someone's feelings if not in good taste.
sentences.cn: 多多称,如果恶作剧的方式不得当,还有可能疏远或伤害别人的感情.

sentences.en: Don't alienate yourself from the masses.
Her attempts to alienate the two friends failed because they had complete faith in each other.
sentences.cn: 她的企图割断两个朋友失败,因为他们已经完全相信对方.

sentences.en: His attempts to alienate the two friends failed because they had complete faith.
sentences.cn: 他离间那两个朋友的企图失败了,因为他们彼此完全信任.

sentences.en: His second wife, Alice, was determined to alienate him from his two boys.
sentences.cn: 他的第2个妻子阿丽丝决心让他疏远他的两个儿子。

sentences.en: Indeed they almost invariably alienate the local population and reflect a land grab.
sentences.cn: 事实上,工业用林无一例外的疏远了当地居民,并表现出一种土地掠夺的倾向.

sentences.en: It also be the perfect way to alienate those all - important independent voters.
sentences.cn: 这也可能是疏远那些非常重要的独立选民的最佳办法.

sentences.en: It would also alienate the politically powerful postal workers.
sentences.cn: 同时,也会孤立那些政治力量雄厚的邮政员.

sentences.en: The executive could not alienate any part of our territory.
sentences.cn: 行政官员不能将我们领土的任何部分让给他人.

sentences.en: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.cn: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

sentences.en: They would forfeit good opportunities for self - improvement and alienate their audiences.
sentences.cn: 他们会失去改进自己的机会,也会使他们和观众越来越疏远.

sentences.en: We'd better not alienate ourselves from the colleagues.
sentences.cn: 我们最好还是不要与同事们疏远.

sentences.en: You need to alienate yourself from them.

words.tran_cn: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
异化；疏远；转让；[内科] 精神错乱；间离效果（alienation effect）

trans.tran_en: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

trans.tran_cn: 使疏远， 离间； 转让， 让渡； 使转移
trans.tran_en: To alienate a person from someone or something that they are normally linked with means to cause them to be emotionally or intellectually separated from them
